dc:description:
*SFTPA2* was first reported in relation to Interstitial Lung Disease (ILD), an autosomal dominant rare disease affecting the distal part of the lung, in 2009 (Wang et al., PMID:19100526). ILD can be described as a family of many lung disorders including idiopathic interstitial pneumonia (IIP) and pneumonitis to the more severe idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). The most common phenotypes of ILD may include shortness of breath, cough, dyspnea, pulmonary fibrosis, and respiratory failure. Sixteen unique variants, all missense, have been reported in 22 probands across five publications (Legendre et al., 2020, PMID: 32855221; van Moorsel et al., 2015, PMID:26568241; Wang et al., 2009, PMID:19100526; Liu L, et al., 2020, PMID:32602668; Sutton et al., 2022, PMID:36135709).  

This gene-disease relationship is also supported by experimental evidence including an expression study that shows a high degree of specificity in the lung tissue (PMID:23715323). Other experimental evidence includes a biochemical function assay that explains how endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress is associated with the development and progression of fibrotic diseases, including idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (Burman et al., 2018, PMID:29567124). Functional alteration studies of variants in A549 cells and type II alveolar cells have been shown to lead to protein instability and increased ER stress (Maitra M et al., PMID: 20466729). In summary, there is definitive evidence supporting the relationship between *SFTPA2* and autosomal dominant ILD. This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both the research and clinical diagnostic settings and has been upheld over time. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Interstitial Lung Disease GCEP on June 20, 2023 (SOP Version 9).

evidence.dc:description: In this study, results show that SP-A variants, G231V and F198S lead to reduced protein stability and ER stress by increasing the expression in A549 cells and type II alveolar cells. The mutations focused upon in this report are individually rare and cannot explain the severe ER stress found in sporadic idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, but they do indicate that the pathway of inherent ER stress resulting from rare inherited surfactant mutations can be an inciting event that leads to pulmonary fibrosis.
evidence.rdfs:label: G231V and F198S Mutant Proteins

evidence.dc:description: A variety of studies implicate ER stress as an important factor in progression of a variety of chronic, fibrotic diseases, including IPF. In the lung, ER stress appears to primarily localize in AECs, where this pathway has been linked to increased AEC apoptosis, as well as other pro-fibrotic phenotypic characteristics. In addition, ER stress in other cell types, including fibroblasts and macrophages, can affect pro-fibrotic responses by these cells.

Prolonged ER stress can induce apoptosis in AECs through several UPR-dependent downstream mechanisms. This results in the loss of lung architecture. A link between ER stress and fibrosis in which ER stress-inducing agents were shown to induce epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT ) in AECs with increased expression of mesenchymal cells. Fibroblast proliferation and differentiation cause excessive collagen production. In macrophages, polarization lead to TGFbeta production.
evidence.rdfs:label: Pro-fibrotic effects of ER stress in Different cell types.

evidence.dc:description: Highly expressed specifically in the lung
This gene is highly expressed specifically in the lung.
evidence.rdfs:label: Bulk Tissue gene expression for SFTPA2

evidence.dc:description:
This proband has a missense variant, Val178Met, that has conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity on ClinVar. This variant is reported in gnomAD v2.1.1. 
https://gnomad.broadinstitute.org/variant/10-81317180-C-T
Transfected A549 cells with this variant showed abundant protein in cell lysates but had significantly less or completely lacked secreted protein in the media collected from the same cells
This proband has a missense variant, Phe198Ser, that is interpreted to be pathogenic in Clinvar. This variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.
Transient transfection in A549 cells showed that the G231V variant was readily detected in the cell lysates, but poorly expressed in the cells, and no protein was detected in the culture medium.
This proband has a missense variant, Gly231Arg, this variant is absent from ClinVar and absent from gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, Arg242Gln. This variant cannot be intercepted on pathogenicity as it is absent from ClinVar. It is reported in gnomAD v2.1.1 
https://gnomad.broadinstitute.org/variant/10-81316987-C-T

Western blots performed on whole cell lysates showed that mutant protein expression was similar to that of normal protein in HEK293T cell lysates​; however, mutant protein is dramatically reduced in the cell medium which indicates that this variant results in the absence of SP-A2 secretion.
This proband has a missense variant, Trp233Leu. There is no interpretation of this variant as it is absent in ClinVar. This variant is also absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

Western blots performed on whole cell lysates showed that mutant protein expression was similar to that of normal protein in HEK293T cell lysates​; however, mutant protein is dramatically reduced in the cell medium which indicates that this variant results in the absence of SP-A2 secretion.

This proband has a missense variant, Val178Met and has conflicting interpretation of pathogenicity in ClinVar.

Western blots performed on whole cell lysates showed that mutant protein expression was similar to that of normal protein in HEK293T cell lysates​; however, mutant protein is dramatically reduced in the cell medium which indicates that this variant results in the absence of SP-A2 secretion.

Transfected A549 cells with this variant showed abundant protein in cell lysates but had significantly less or completely lacked secreted protein in the media collected from the same cells

evidence.rdfs:label: Family CKG810

member.rdfs:label: Patient_CKG810:III-4
member.phenotypeFreeText: Open lung biopsy with usual interstitial pneumonitis (UIP) with hyperplastic type II pneumocytes. Well-differentiated adenocarcinoma (with extensive bronchioloalveolar features, multifocal, dispersed within a substrate of diffuse interstitial fibrosis, T4N0M0. FVC 37%, FEV1 40%. Underwent bilateral lung transplantation.
member.previousTestingDescription: Screened for variants in TERT and TERC, amplified the coding exons and consensus splicing sequences of SFTPA1, and performed linkage analysis. Sequenced the coding exons and consensus splicing sequences of the gene encoding SP-D in the proband of family F27 and in 32 other probands.

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Proband was reported to have lung cancer and pulmonary fibrosis.

evidence.dc:description: There was only 1 segregation for this family.
evidence.rdfs:label: 8-GM03569

member.rdfs:label: 8-GM03569:IV-4
member.detectionMethod: Coding exons and flanking intronic junctions of SFTPA1 and SFTPA2 were sequenced with a custom-targeted capture panel
member.phenotypeFreeText: Indeterminate pattern on CT scan. Exposure to tobacco, dust, and cannabis. Proband died at 41 years from lung fibrosis and adenocarcinoma progression.
member.previousTestingDescription: Patients did not have telomerase complex mutations.

member.rdfs:label: Patient__Identical_N210T
member.detectionMethod: All coding regions of SFTPA2 were sequenced.
member.previousTestingDescription: Patients did not have mutations in SFTPC, TERT, TERC, or TINF2.

member.rdfs:label: Patient_FPF15
member.detectionMethod: All coding regions of SFTPA2 were sequenced.
member.previousTestingDescription: Patients did not have mutations in SFTPC, TERT, TERC, or TINF2.

member.rdfs:label: Liu_Patient_II-4
member.detectionMethod: Genomic DNA was extracted from peripheral blood lymphocytes. Whole‐exome sequencing was used to analyze the genetic factors of large IPF family.
member.phenotypeFreeText: Proband was reported with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (ORPHA:2032)
member.previousTestingDescription: 18 candidate mutations including the novel mutation were found after whole-exome sequencing was undertaken. Further Sanger sequencing revealed that only the novel mutation p.N207Y was present in the affected individuals and absent in the healthy family members.

member.rdfs:label: Patient_FPF45
member.detectionMethod: All coding regions of SFTPA2 were sequenced.
member.phenotypeFreeText: Non-classifiable ILD found on HRCT scan.
member.previousTestingDescription: Patients did not have mutations in SFTPC, TERT, TERC, or TINF2.

evidence.dc:description: Sequenced SFTPA1 & SFTPA2
evidence.rdfs:label: Family F27

member.rdfs:label: Patient_F27-IV:8
member.detectionMethod: We performed a whole genome linkage analysis of 29 family members by using the Illumina Linkage IVb SNP panel of >6,000 SNPs. Selectively amplified the coding exons and consensus splicing sequences of SFTPA2. Sequencing was then performed.
member.phenotypeFreeText: There was a total lung capacity: 78%; diffusion capacity for carbon monoxide: 71%; open lung biopsy: IPF with emphysematous changes
member.previousTestingDescription: Screened for variants in TERT and TERC, amplified the coding exons and consensus splicing sequences of SFTPA1 and SFTPA2, and performed linkage analysis. Sequenced the coding exons and consensus splicing sequences of the gene encoding SP-D in the proband of family F27 and in 32 other probands.

member.rdfs:label: Patient_FPF5
member.detectionMethod: All coding regions of SFTPA2 were sequenced.
member.previousTestingDescription: Patients did not have mutations in SFTPC, TERT, TERC, or TINF2.

evidence.dc:description: This proband has a missense variant,  Asn171Ile, that is pathogenic on ClinVar. This variant is not reported in gnomAD v2.1.1.

Western blots performed on whole cell lysates showed that mutant protein expression was similar to that of normal protein in HEK293T cell lysates​; however, mutant protein is dramatically reduced in the cell medium which indicates that this variant results in the absence of SP-A2 secretion.
This proband has a missense variant, Asn171Tyr, that is absent in ClinVar. This variant is also absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

Wt and the p.N207Y mutant plasmids were constructed and transfected into A549 cell lines to perform functional analysis.  Functional research revealed that this mutation can affect the secretion of the SFTPA2 protein and induce ER stress and apoptosis.
